A: The product produced by Enterprise has not been updated with the product design during the process optimization.
B: Some of the process improvements suggested by assembly line workers are adopted, but most are not implemented.
C: Optimizing production processes, while raising the average age of the labor force on the assembly line, may increase labor productivity.
D: Assembly line workers today need math skills to do their jobs.
explanation: The enterprise has laid off many junior and young employees and hired fewer assembly line workers to produce more products in order to achieve the purpose of improving labor productivity. Therefore, optimizing the production process will increase the average age of the labor force on the assembly line, and at the same time may increase labor productivity.

context: Wang Er attended an international summer camp and lived in a four-room room after entering the camp. But since Wang Er was the last one to arrive, the first three people introduced themselves respectively. So they decided to ask Wang Er to guess their names. They found that one of the three men told every word that was not true, one that was true, and one that was true. The first one said, “My name is Zhang SAN, the second one is Li Si, and the third one is Wang Wu.“ The second man said, “My name is Zhao Liu, and the third man is Qian SAN. If you ask him, he will definitely say his name is Zhang SAN.“ The third man said, “My name is Qian SAN, the first man is Wang Wu, and the second man is Li Si.“
question: Based on the above information, which of the following can be inferred
A: The first person is Zhang SAN and the second person is Li Si.
B: The first person is Wang Wu and the third person is Qian SAN.
C: The second person is Wang Wu and the third person is Zhao Liu.
D: The second person is Zhao Liu and the third person is Qian SAN.
explanation: Explanation “:“ Every explanation is true and false: one of the three tells every lie, one speaks the truth, and the other tells the truth. Because among the three people's answers, only the second person's answer has two sentences confirmed by the first person and the third person respectively. Therefore, the second person is not telling the truth. Otherwise no one would be telling the truth; And since both the first person and the third person said that the second person's name was Li Si, if the second person's name was true, then the second person could only be a lie, a contradiction. Therefore. The second man calls Li Si false; therefore, the second man speaks the truth. Since the second person is telling the truth, then the third person is Qian SAN, which is consistent with his own answer. So the third person is true or false. And every word of the first man is false. Therefore, the first person is not Zhang SAN, the second person is Zhao Liu, the third person is Qian SAN.

context: R Hospital has topped the “My Most Satisfied Hospital“ survey conducted by City C for the fifth consecutive year, due to the fact that the hospital provides superior referral services than other hospitals, according to the hospital's director.
question: Which of the following is true and best supports the opinion of the person in charge of the hospital
A: Every major hospital in C city has invested a lot of energy in the guidance service, trying to improve the quality of the guidance service
B: B: “The survey of“ My most satisfied hospital “in C City has been carried out for 20 years, and the top one is all public hospitals
C: There are 200 hospitals in C city, not all of them participated in this survey
D: It has the same medical level as R hospital, but the ranking of poor guidance service is not as good as R hospital
explanation: First step, determine the question type. According to the word “support“ in the question, it is determined to strengthen the argument. Second, look for arguments and evidence. Thesis: R Hospital topped the “My Most Satisfied Hospital“ survey conducted by C City for 5 years in a row. Argument: The hospital provides superior referral services than other hospitals. Third, identify the options. A: Irrelevant. It is not certain whether the quality of guidance service has been improved after the major hospitals have invested their efforts. The relationship between quality and ranking has not been discussed. B) No, no, no, no. The top of the list are all public hospitals, but there is no mention of the relationship between public hospitals and hospital R, the topic is inconsistent, excluded. C: Add a contrarian argument. Not all hospitals participated in the survey, which was conducted from an unrepresentative and debilitating sample. D) Add to the argument. D) Hospitals with poor guidance services rank poorly, while hospitals with good guidance services rank highly. By comparison, it is concluded that there is a correlation between the guidance services and the ranking, which has a strengthening effect

context: Language plays an important role in human communication. However, if the human auditory system is defective in its ability to receive sound signals, then not every possible combination of the basic language will be capable of being an independent and understandable word.
question: Which of the following can be deduced from the above statement?
A: If the human auditory system is functioning properly in receiving sound signals, then each of the basic languages of a language may
B: The effectiveness of language enhances the usefulness of human communication.
C: If the human auditory system is defective in its ability to receive sound signals, language cannot be fully effective
D: Every possible combination of the basic language would not be able to express an independent meaning if language were not perfectly efficient
explanation: 1 The language is completely valid - Every possible combination of the basic language is capable of expressing words with independent meaning and comprehensible meaning. 2. There is a problem with the function of the human auditory system to receive sound signals → Not every possible combination of the basic language can become an independent meaning and understandable word. Language is perfectly valid Every possible combination of the basic language is capable of expressing words with independent meanings and intelligibility The human auditory system is capable of receiving sound signals without problems

context: In recent years, more and more newlyweds are registering their personal property before they get married. This practice is beneficial to both society and the family. It should be advocated, or at least not opposed.

context: In the 1970s there was an oversupply of college graduates, which reduced the average annual earnings of college graduates to just 18 percent higher than those of workers with only a high school diploma. By the 1980s, the average annual earnings of college graduates were 43% higher than those of workers with only a high school diploma, even though the supply of college graduates did not decline during the 1970s and late 1980s.
question: Which of the following, if true in the late 1980s, best moderates the apparent divergence described above?
A: Economic development has slowed down, which has reduced the demand for college students
B: The quality of high school education has improved.
C: More high schools have career guidance programs for their students than in the 1970s
D: For the first time in two decades, there is an oversupply of job seekers with only a high school diploma
explanation: There is no great change in the supply of college students in the two different times, but the relative level of wages changes, indicating that the supply of high school diploma workers has changed.

context: Measures for the Administration of Energy Efficiency Labeling“ stipulate that energy efficiency level 5 is the lowest energy efficiency standard, which is the minimum requirement for product marketing. C: The product can be considered energy saving if it meets the level 2 energy efficiency standard.
D: Energy efficiency level 5 products are qualified products and energy saving products.
explanation: All energy-saving products must meet the level 2 energy efficiency standard or above“ can be launched from the explanation, “energy-saving products must be marked with Level 2 or Level 1 energy efficiency label“

context: The original meaning of learning is related to people's lives and life, but if learning becomes a slogan or dogma, it will lose its original meaning. Therefore, no learning should become a slogan or dogma
question: Which of the following is most similar to the argument above?
A: A disc is a tissue that has no blood circulation, but it needs to be fed by the blood that flows around it if it is to function properly, so it should be difficult to grow a functioning artificial disc.
B: The brain can change real experience, but if the brain is just a filing cabinet for real experience, it will not be modified, so the brain should not be just a filing cabinet for real experience.
C: AI should be able to tell that both a black cat and a white cat are cats, but it cannot tell that both are cats without AI digesting a large number of photos beforehand, so AI must first digest a large number of photos.

context: According to the existing laws of physics. No matter can move faster than the speed of light, but a new astronomical observation challenges this law. B: If astronomers' observations are correct, the law of constant speed of light will need to be modified.
C: Either the astronomer's observations are wrong, or someone has tampered with the astronomical data.
D: The law of constant speed of light has been tested by practice many times, and no counterexample has emerged.
explanation: explanation: Astronomers find that the speed of gamma rays exceeds the speed of light and conclude that the law of light speed does not change needs to be revised

context: As an administrative employee of Company H, Xiao Zhang received the president's bonus.
question: If the above statement is true, which of the following cannot be determined to be true or false

context: Currently, the speed limit on this highway is 90 km/h, while many drivers drive at 100 km/h, a trend that promotes disrespect for the regulations. The authorities should raise the speed limit to 100km/h. In this way, people will be allowed to drive at a reasonable speed without encouraging people to break the law.
question: Which of the following, if true, most weakens the above argument?
A: When the speed limit is raised to 100 km/h, people will drive at 110 km/h.
B: The new more efficient car does not need to use more fuel when traveling at 100 km/h.
C: Many speeding drivers use electronic devices to detect police radar so as not to be caught
D: More speeders will be caught and fined during periods when the police pay special attention to speed limits.
explanation: Method: Increase the speed limit from 90 km/h to 100 km/h. Aim: It will allow people to drive at a reasonable speed without encouraging people to break the law.

context: If a country does not have the key technologies of the chip industry, its chip industry will be subject to others. If a country's chip industry is subject to others, it will not have a complete chip industry chain. As long as a country has a complete chip industry chain, it will have the right to speak.
question: According to the above statement, which of the following must be true
A: If a country's chip industry is not controlled by others, it will not have a say.
B: If a country has key technologies in the chip industry, it has a complete chip industry chain.
C: If a country owns the complete chip industry chain, it will not have the right to speak.
D: If one country has a say, it means it has the key technology of the chip industry.
explanation: ① There is no key technology of the chip industry → the chip industry is subject to others ② The chip industry is subject to others → it will not have the complete chip industry chain ③ it has the right to speak → it has the complete chip industry chain. Combined conditions ①②③ can be obtained: ④ have the right to speak (P) → have the complete chip industry chain (Q) → the chip industry is not subject to others (M) → have the key technology of the chip industry (N). A: Option = the chip industry is not subject to others (M) a → will not have the right to speak (-P), and condition ④ is not consistent, can not judge its true or false. B: Option = owning the key technology of the chip industry (N) I → owning the complete chip industry chain (Q), which is inconsistent with the condition and cannot be judged true or false. C: Option = have the complete chip industry chain (Q) → will not have the right to speak (-P), is inconsistent with condition ④, can not judge its true or false. D: Option = have the right to say (P) → have the key technology of the chip industry (N), consistent with condition ④, must be true

context: In 2010, the Ministry of Health introduced new national standards for the dairy industry. The protein content of raw milk was reduced from 2.95% to 2.85%. The new standard will go down instead of up. It caused a lot of skepticism. An industry insider explained. If our milk testing standards set the protein content too high. In order to meet the standard, dairy farmers will add things to milk that increase the protein level, such as melamine, and the melamine incident in 2008 showed that the standard was too high.
question: Which of the following reasoning contains the same logical error as the reasoning of the industry person?
A: Truly strong people are not afraid of difficulties or challenges. Zhao Tao is afraid of difficulties or challenges. That means Zhao Tao is not really strong.
B: Donations will be made to a charity only if people trust it. Therefore, a charity that does not receive donations must have lost the public's trust.
C: If the typhoon makes landfall in Haikou, the flight to Haikou will be cancelled. Now flights to Haikou have not been cancelled. That means the typhoon did not make landfall in Haikou.
D: If there are loopholes in the management of the railway department. There will be accidents in railway transportation. The July 23 high-speed train accident in Wenzhou shows that there are loopholes in railway management.
explanation: An industry insider's reasoning is: If the standards are too high. Dairy farmers add melamine in order to meet the standards; Melamine happened. The standard is too high and the reasoning structure is: if p. then q; There is q; Hence p. D is similar to this reasoning structure

context: Larry the tabby cat, the UK's chief mouser, has been called to step down by some people for not doing his job properly because of his inactivity. However, some media outlets have also launched a campaign to support the move, saying that“ rights and obligations are not equal “and Downing Street (the British government's name) has no reason to let the mouser go
question: If the following are true, what best supports the media's view is:
A: Research shows that the number of stray cats adopted nationwide has increased by 20% since Larry became a rat catcher. Larry's tenure has set a good example for societ
B: Larry is not a rat catcher by nature and his selection for the post was not carefully scrutinised by Downing Street staff
C: Larry is not paid by Downing Street and his rations are paid for entirely by Downing Street staff
D: Because of his lovely appearance and meek disposition, Larry is often given extra diplomatic duties
explanation: Step 1: Find the argument arguments. Argument: Larry has unequal rights and obligations, and Downing Street has no reason to dismiss the mouser. Argument: None. Step 2: Analyze the options one by one. A: “The number of stray cats adopted has increased by 20%“ indicates that Larry has improved the current situation of stray cats in the UK and fulfilled one of his obligations. However, it is not clear whether Larry has obtained his corresponding rights. B: “Larry is not a rat catcher by nature“, indicating that Larry is not capable of fulfilling his obligations, but whether his rights and obligations are equal is not mentioned, cannot be supported, excluded; C) He is a rat. Item C tells us that Downing Street did not pay Larry a salary, and his rations were all bought by Downing Street staff. It shows that even if Larry fulfilled his duty of trapping mice, he did not have the rights that Downing Street gave him, so Larry's rights and obligations are not equal. Downing Street had no reason to dismiss the mousecatcher, explained the argument, could be supported, elected; D: Similarly to A, Larry was given additional diplomatic reception duties because of his character and appearance, indicating that he fulfilled one of his obligations, but whether Larry was granted his corresponding rights is not clear and excluded.

context: The impact of the German economy on the sweeping global financial crisis is less than that of other developed countries, the main reason is that the German economy is built on the basis of advanced manufacturing industry, German machinery equipment and automobile manufacturing industry has maintained strong competitiveness. Some people draw a conclusion based on the example of Germany: only with a strong level of manufacturing competition, a country's economy can have a high degree of stability
question: If the following are true, which of the following can question the above conclusion:
A: Some countries with underdeveloped manufacturing industries were less affected by the financial crisis
B: B) A country with an underdeveloped manufacturing industry has been experiencing turbulence in its econ
C: C) Some countries have maintained long-term economic stability without a developed manufacturing indus
D: Some countries have developed manufacturing but have not maintained long-term economic stability
explanation: Step one: Find the arguments and arguments. Argument: Only with a strong level of manufacturing competition can a country's economy have a high degree of certainty, that is, the economy has a high degree of certainty → it has a strong level of manufacturing competition. Argument: The German economy is based on advanced manufacturing. Germany's machinery and car manufacturing industries have remained highly competitive, making the German economy less vulnerable to the global financial crisis than other developed countries. Step 2: Determine the weakening method. There is a causal connection between the argument and the argument that requires weakening. Step 3: Judge the effect of the options one by one. A) The situation of some countries with underdeveloped manufacturing industries is not directly related to having a high degree of economic certainty → having a strong level of manufacturing competition. B) The country's economy is in turmoil and its manufacturing industry is underdeveloped. C) The country has a high degree of economic certainty → a strong level of manufacturing competition. C, “Economy with high certainty → strong competition level of manufacturing industry“ is the contradiction relationship of the thesis “economy with high certainty → strong competition level of manufacturing industry“, which directly negates the thesis and weakens the effect obviously; D) Some countries have developed manufacturing industries, but their economies have not been stable for a long time, which has no direct relationship with “high economic certainty → strong manufacturing competition level“

context: In China, since 1994, the sponsor group of the National People's Congress has received one proposal every year calling for a law on euthanasia. explanation: Based on“ Well used...“ “And“ Well used...“ It can be inferred that sometimes the law may also be used by people to do unjust things. The correct answer is C

context: The core business secrets of a syndicate stored in a dedicated computer were stolen. 3. Three senior employees of the consortium, A, B and Ne, have been detained in connection with the case. A: There is A among the perpetrators.
B: One of the perpetrators is B.
C: There is C among the perpetrators.
D: A, B and C are all perpetrators.
explanation: ① The perpetrator → trained, which is equivalent to: trained → the perpetrator. ② A → C. ③ B → Trained. A V B V C. From ③, ① in series: B 1 → trained 1 → perpetrator, that is: 5 B is not the perpetrator: or B collaborates with others in the crime. If B is not the perpetrator, then from ④ we get: a V C, which is equivalent to: ③ a a → C. From ② and ③, we get: C. Therefore, there is C among the perpetrators. If B commits the crime together with others, if his accomplice is A, it is known by ② that C also commits the crime. If his accomplice is not A, the accomplice must be C. To sum up, C must have committed the crime.

context: There are A, B, C and D in a company whose native places are Beijing, Shanghai, Guanjin and Nanjing. One day, four people were talking about their respective places of origin. B: Neither C nor Ding comes from Beijing

By comparing conditions (2) and (3), we can see that “B is not from Shanghai“ and “B is from Shanghai“ must be one true and one false. Since each person in condition (3) is two true and one false, then “C is from Tianjin“ involved in both conditions (2) and (3) is true. Because C is from Tianjin, so according to the condition ④ know Ding for Beijing, put the result into ③ we know, B is Shanghai: put into ③ we know, a is Nanjing.

context: Since the 1980s, the population of the striped owl has declined dramatically and is now in danger of becoming extinct. Timber harvesting companies are to blame for this. The old forest areas they harvest in large numbers are the owl's habitat. Researcher Li: Timber logging companies cannot be blamed for the decline in striped owl numbers. In the last 30 years, a more fertile species of striped owl has moved into older forest areas and is competing with the striped owl for resources
question: Which of the following most accurately summarizes Researcher Li's rebuttal to Professor Zhang's views
A: rejects Professor Zhang's premise, which is that the timber harvesting company has been cutting in the old forest ar
B: questions Professor Zhang's hypothesis that owls can only survive in old forest areas
C: Proposes an alternative explanation for the decline of the striped owl population
D: suggests that Professor Zhang exaggerates the negative effects of logging in old forest areas
explanation: Professor Zhang's view is that the decline of the striped owl population is due to timber harvesting; Li's view is that the striped owl's entry into old forest areas, not timber harvesting, is the reason for the striped owl's decline. (C) The reasons for the striped owl's decline are different. (C) The reasons for the owl's decline are different. (D) Li did not comment on the felling of the owl. Li's explanation also relies on the assumption that owls can only survive in old forest areas. (B) They rely on the same assumption

context: The regular cable company provides his customers with 50 TV channels, but the new fiber allows the telephone company to provide his customers with 100 to 150 TV channels, charged the same price as the cable company, only 50 yuan, so that in a few years the cable company will be replaced by the telephone company offering the new TV service.

context: Zhang Qiang and Zhao Mei were childhood friends, and Zhang Qiang has always had a crush on Zhao Mei. One day, Zhang Qiang said to Zhao Mei: “Since you, life is a miracle.“ Zhao Mei saw through Zhang Qiang's mind and said to him, “Now you don't have me.“

B: B: In Zhang Qiang's life, there can be no miracles in the future
C: There must be miracles in Zhang Qiang's life in the future.

context: There is no doubt that underage smoking should be banned. However, we should not ban the use of vending machines in order to prevent underage smoking from taking advantage of them. context: To test the efficacy of a new drug for high blood pressure, clinicians gave it to 100 patients with high blood pressure. Sixty-five of them actually saw their blood pressure drop, so the manufacturer declared that the drug was effective

context: In spite of the downturn, airlines are not cutting back on advertising. The evening papers of many cities have recently been running advertisements such as: Planes are far safer than cars! Eg. You shouldn't be frightened by the exaggerated reports about the air crash. According to the Airline Industry Association, one person dies every 100 million kilometers traveled by plane, while one person dies every 50 million kilometers traveled by car. The Association of Automobile Manufacturers was so annoyed by the AD that they went on television to announce another number: one death per 200,000 flight hours for airplanes and one death per two million for cars
question: If all the above information is true, which of the following best explains this seemingly contradictory conclusion
A: Safety is only one aspect that people consider when choosing a means of transportation. Convenience, comfort and a special experience will all influence consumers' choice.
B: Although the pilot of an airplane has far more specialized training than the driver of an automobile, the survival rate of an airplane crash is lower than that of a car accident because of the altitude at which he flies
C: It's true that planes are safer than cars, but air accidents make far more headlines than car accidents, so they leave an especially strong impression on people
D: Comparing the safety of two vehicles with completely different speeds by using the operating distance as a unit is not comprehensive, and using the operating time as a unit will cause deviation.
explanation: Contradiction to be explained: According to the statistics of the aviation industry association, one person dies every 100 million kilometers for an airplane, while one person dies every 50 million kilometers for a car. Therefore, an airplane is safer than a car; However, the association of the Automobile Industry has released another figure: one person dies every 200,000 flying hours, and one person dies every 2 million driving hours. Cars are safer than planes.

context: There have been more than 230 earthquakes of magnitude 3 or greater in an area since 2014, compared with one a year before 2008. The frequent dumping of garbage raises questions. Some researchers have found that since 2014 the region has begun injecting toxic waste water from the drilling and hydraulic fracturing process into impervious layers of underground rocks, which may have been a key cause of the earthquakes.
question: Which of the following, if true, best supports the conclusion above?
A: The injection of wastewater into the rock water layer will reduce the friction between faults and make them slip more easily, thus inducing earthquakes.
B: Since 2008, more oil reserves have been explored in this region and oil extraction activity has increased substantially.
C: Most successive earthquakes are a series of aftershocks following a strong earthquake, but this is not the case here.
D: Every earthquake in this area is preceded by tornadoes, which also send toxic waste water into the impervious layers of underground rocks.
explanation: Premise: Pour the waste water into the impervious layer of underground rocks (cause) Conclusion: Cause earthquake (result) Pour the waste water into the water layer of rock to reduce friction, easier to slide - cause earthquake.

context: After a safety inspection of small coal mines in the whole province, personnel A, B and C have the following conclusions: A small coal mine has potential safety risks. B: There are no safety risks in small coal mines. C: Dayun and Hongtong are two small coal mines with no safety risks.
question: If only one of the above three conclusions is true, which of the following must be true
A: Neither Dayun nor Hongtong Coal Mine has any potential safety risks
B: Both Dayun and Hongtong Coal mines have safety risks.
C: There is a safety hazard in Dayun, but not in Hongtong.
D: There is no safety hazard in Dayun, but there is a safety hazard in Hongtong.
explanation: The words of A and B constitute the“ lower opposition “relationship, and at least one of them is true. Therefore, C's words must be false. This leads to the conclusion that at least one of the two small mines, Dayun and Hongtong, has security risks. Therefore, it is true that “there are safety risks in small coal mines“, but it is false that B is false, so its contradictory proposition “All small coal mines have safety risks“ must be true, and of course all small coal mines include Dayun and Hongtong

context: Consumer representative:“ Unless all food safety is necessarily assured, some policies may not be enforced.“ Fda spokesperson: “I disagree with you.“

context: A 15-year study of more than 45,000 Swedish soldiers found that heavy marijuana users were six times more likely to develop schizophrenia than non-users. context: It is reported that global temperatures have continued to rise over the past 150 years due to massive human emissions of greenhouse gases. However, compared with the 1970-1998 period, the increase in global surface average temperature has slowed significantly since 1999, and the average temperature has not increased significantly in the last 15 years, so global warming is not that serious.
question: If the following are true, what most weakens the argument above is:
A: The adjustment processes of the ocean and climate system allow the transfer of heat from the ocean surface to the deep ocean
B: This phenomenon occurred during the 1950s to 1970s and then began to warm at an accelerated pace
C: C: UN climate experts say the concentration of carbon dioxide in the air is at its highest in 800,000 yea
D: D) a number of natural disasters caused by climate change have occurred in recent yea
explanation: First step, determine the question type. According to the word “weaken“ in the way of questioning, it is determined to weaken the argument. Second, look for arguments and arguments. Argument: Global warming is not that bad. The argument: The global average surface temperature has risen at a significantly slower rate since 1999 than it did from 1970 to 1998, and the average temperature has not risen significantly in the last 15 years. Third, identify the options. Item A: Add to the evidence. By showing that heat from the surface of the ocean is transferred to the deep sea, and that surface temperatures are reduced, it reinforces the idea that global warming is not so severe. B) Add to the counter-argument. (b) The argument that the slow rise in surface temperatures is temporary is weakened by the fact that similar phenomena have occurred before. C) The effect of temperature increases on the surface. C) The relationship between carbon dioxide concentration and climate warming needs further clarification. D) A) A) A) A) A) A) A) A) A) A) (D) There have been many natural disasters caused by global warming in recent years. (D) Global warming is less serious. (D) Global warming is less serious

context: Monthly car sales in Chunjiang have held steady over the last year. A: In the first three months of the implementation of the new exhaust emission standards, all brands of vehicles except Hongda in Chunjiang
B: In the three months prior to the implementation of the new exhaust emission standard, the sales volume of all brands except Hongda cars was in

explanation: explanation: In the first three months of the implementation of the new emission standards, the monthly sales volume of Hongda in Chunjiang is still at the level reached at the end of last year, but the sales share of Hongda in the Chunjiang car market is obviously declining. The sales market share of this brand is equal to the sales of all brands X100%. Conclusion: HTC's sales were unchanged, but its market share declined, indicating that sales of other brands increased during the three months

context: Master Honyun said that it is commendable for a man to do a good deed if he can overcome great temptation in order to do it. Master Honwoon also said that sometimes it is praiseworthy for a person to do a good deed out of sheer habit, even instinct.
question: Which of the following, if true, can reasonably state that the above two statements of Master Honyun seem contradictory but are not in fact in conflict?
A: One becomes a saint only by facing and overcoming great temptation for years. A saint does good by habit and instinct.
B: Not everything good needs to be done by overcoming great temptation.
C: A man who overcomes great temptation to do good does not think whether he will be praised or not.
D: Whether he has overcome some temptation, whether it is entirely out of habit, is a matter of the heart of a man, no one knows
explanation: Everyone can first overcome the hundred temptations to do good. After overcoming the temptations, good deeds can be done by instinct. The two are not contradictory.

If the delay is less than 24 hours, -P will not constitute a contradiction of information. ⅱ. The airline company agrees to arrange a rest in a hotel above three stars. context: According to the latest statistics of first-tier cities such as Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou and Shenzhen, the volume of housing transactions in 2017 was relatively stable compared to the previous years. context: The squirrel burrows in the trunk of a tree to drain the SAP of the tree. Since tree SAP is mostly water with some sugar in it, the squirrel goes after water or sugar. And since there's no shortage of water around the trees, the squirrels don't have to dig as hard to get water. So the purpose of the burrow is to get sugar.
question: Which of the following best summarizes the above method of argument?
A: By negating one of the two possibilities, we affirm the other.
B: Generalize the general conclusion by some special case.
C: To draw an analogy between a known phenomenon and an unknown phenomenon.
D: Negate the general conclusion by counterexample.
explanation: explanation: The squirrel's target is water or sugar: since there is no shortage of water around the tree, the squirrel doesn't have to dig a hole so hard to get water, so the squirrel's target is sugar. The symbol is: water V sugar, one water, therefore sugar.

context: Breakups are not only psychologically painful, they may also cause physical pain. Us researchers recruited 40 volunteers who had been forced to break up with their spouses in the past six months and still didn't mind being rejected. Using functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) to look at the volunteers' brain activity, the researchers found that the parts of the brain that respond to social rejection, such as a breakup, coincide with those that respond to somatic pain, so social rejection like a breakup can cause physical pain
question: What are the assumptions underlying this conclusion?
A: Functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) is currently a common method for brain localization.
B: Changes in an individual's emotional and other psychological processes can affect his physiological responses.
C: Physical and psychological reactions can be linked through the brain.
D: Physical pain is always manifested through mental activity.
explanation: Premise: The part of the brain that responds to social rejection, such as a breakup, coincides with the part that responds to physical pain. Conclusion: Social rejection such as breakup can cause physical pain.

context: A theater plans to put on seven plays in seven weeks in the fall. They are F, G, J, K, O, R, S. A play is presented each week, with each play running for exactly one week, and the play schedule must meet the following conditions: (1) G must be presented in the third week. (2) O and S cannot be performed back-to-back. (3) K must be arranged to be performed before J and S. (4) F and J must be performed on two consecutive weeks.
question: Which of the following must be true for any acceptable arrangement
A: F is scheduled for a week after K.
B: G happens to be scheduled the week before O.
C: J is scheduled for the first week.
D: R is scheduled for the second or seventh week
explanation: According to condition (3), K is arranged before J. And according to condition (4), F and J are continuous, so K must be arranged before F.

context: Four persons A, B, C and D are involved in a robbery and a theft. Both cases were committed by individuals. It is possible that one of the four individuals committed both cases, or that they committed two separate cases. Those who are known to have committed the crime must have told nothing but lies, and those who have not committed the crime must have told nothing but the truth. A: I didn't commit the robbery. C: Ding committed the robbery. B: C told a lie. Ding said, “C tells the truth.
question: According to the above information, which of the following must be true
A: Ding committed burglary and robbery.
B: B committed robbery, D committed theft.
C: C committed theft and D committed robbery.
D: C committed robbery and D committed theft.
explanation: To tell the truth, C can start from D's explanation. Hypothesis: If Ding tells the truth, it means that Ding did not commit the crime. When Ding says C is telling the truth, C says: Ding committed a robbery. Inconsistent, so what Ding said must be a lie. Therefore, Ding said: C is telling the truth, so C is telling a lie. C said: Ding committed robbery, therefore Ding did not commit robbery. So Ding must have committed theft. He also knew that he had told a lie, so he also committed a crime. So this case must be two people doing two different cases. D committed theft, so C committed robbery.

context: Scientists have long been interested in studying normal information forgetting in humans. The conventional wisdom is that certain memories are held in certain synaptic connections, and over time, when those synaptic connections change, people forget things. The new research suggests that forgetting may not be because synaptic connections change, but rather because dopamine neurons block retrieval without destroying the memory itself
question: Which of the following, if true, best casts doubt on recent research claims?
A: Many childhood experiences will be gradually forgotten as we grow up, may not be able to recall.
B: Diseases that affect memory, such as Alzheimer's disease, are often associated with amyloid beta.
C: Research confirms that dopamine neurons are active when synaptic connections are altered.
D: Damage to the temporal lobe will result in memory impairment related to semantic and scene memory.
explanation: The explanation is that the reason for forgetting is not that synaptic connections are changed, but that dopamine neurons block the retrieval of memories without destroying the memories themselves. (Instead of A and C, B one →C).

context: Enceladus is one of the three bodies in the solar system that have been observed to have geological eruptions so far, and is one of the most important objects of astrobiology study. This leads to the possibility of liquid water on Enceladus, and possibly even a “subsurface ocean.
question: Which of the following, if true, best supports the above conjecture?
A: Geological eruptive activity is possible only if there is a subsurface sea.
B: Without geological eruptive activity on Enceladus, sodium salts could not have been found.
C: The data from the analytical instruments on the Saturn probe are accurate and reliable.
D: Particles of sodium salt can exist only in the presence of liquid water.
explanation: If there are sodium salts, then there is liquid water, or even“ subsurface seas “. Sodium salt is a sufficient condition for liquid water. A: It has nothing to do with the speculation. B: The relationship between sodium salts and liquid water, not how sodium salts are produced. C: Supports the premise that the research methods are correct but have limited effect on the relationship. D: The presence of sodium salts is a sufficient condition for liquid water, and the prediction of the inevitability of liquid water from sodium salts is strongest

context: The Earth in its early days was two rapidly rotating bodies of molten rock, with most of the iron in its core. Some molten rock ejected from the surface of this rotation and later condensed to form the moon.

B: The moon has a smaller proportion of iron than the core of the Earth.

D: The moon, like the Earth, has a solid surface structure and a molten core.
explanation: The explanation for the formation of the moon explains that most of the iron elements are at the core of the Earth. Some lava has been thrown from the surface of this rotating body, which means that the moon formed as a result of the ejection would have a smaller proportion of iron than the Earth's core.

context: Xiao Wang, Xiao Li and Xiao Zhang are going to climb a mountain. The weather forecast says it may rain today. The three people argued about the weather forecast. It just means that it is not inevitable that it will not rain today. It is up to you to decide whether to climb the mountain or not.“
question: Which of the following is true of the understanding of weather forecasting?

explanation: It may rain today“, and Xiao Wang's explanation is “It may not rain today = it may rain today“. Xiao Li deduce from the explanation that it may rain today that it is actually raining today. Xiao Zhang's conclusion is “it is not inevitable that it will not rain = it is not inevitable that it will not rain = it may rain today“, which is correct

context: The American Ornithological Foundation just released the State of America's Birds report. question: Which of the following do you think is not appropriate?
A: Cholesterol and vitamins in the blood may help improve female mosquito reproduction
B: Male mosquitoes don't bite because they don't need sugary substances
C: Some people may get more mosquito bites than others in the same environment, probably because they have a scent that attracts mosquitoe
D: Mosquitoes have evolved a special ability to screen for bites, which helps them reproduce
explanation: explanation“ B “: “explanation“ is too absolute. The title explains that “female mosquitoes need some sugar in their blood“ does not mean that male mosquitoes do not need sugar. The cause-and-effect relationship is also not established. The male mosquito does not bite because he does not need to absorb sugar from the blood for his eggs.

context: A man can only do his best if he knows what he is doing.“
question: All of the following terms accurately express the meaning of the above determination, except?
A: A man cannot make the best of his abilities unless he knows how to do his duty.
B: If you don't know that a man can do his job well, he can't do his job well.
C: If you can make the best use of your talents, you must know that you are good at your job.
D: If you know a man to do his duty well, you will make the most of his abilities.
explanation: Explanation“ can be translated into: able to make the best of men (P) → know that men are good at their duties (Q) = not know that men are good at their duties (-Q) → unable to make the best of men (-P). A: Option = being able to make the best of people → knowing people being able to do their jobs =P→Q, which is the same as the explanation. B: Not knowing people well → not being able to make the best of them = O→-P. C: Being able to make the most of one's talents -- knowing one's duties well =P to Q. D) Knowing people well → being able to make the best of their abilities =Q→

context: “There are two very strange brothers. The elder brother tells the truth in the morning and lies in the afternoon. The younger brother, on the other hand, lies all the time in the morning and tells the truth in the afternoon. A passer-by asked: “Which of you is the elder brother?“ The fat man said I was the elder brother, and the thin man said I was the elder brother. The passer-by asked again, “What time is it?“ The fat man said it was nearly noon, and the thin man said it was already past noon
question: Which of the following must be true
A: It's afternoon now.
B: Fat man is the brother.
C: The thin man is the older brother.
D: Thin man speaks the truth at this time.
explanation: To determine whether it is true or false: I. Select the hypothesis object. The key lies in the selection:“ Brother tells the truth in the morning and lies in the afternoon; Brother lies in the morning and tells the truth in the afternoon “, we know that the true or false situation is determined by “is it morning or afternoon“, so the hypothesis content is locked as “is it morning or afternoon“. ⅱ. Make assumptions and reasoning: suppose now is “morning“, if asked “who is the elder brother“, the elder brother will say “I am the elder brother“, the younger brother will say “I am the elder brother“; Suppose now is “afternoon“, then the elder brother will say “I am the younger brother“, the younger brother will say “I am the younger brother“, combined with the information can be determined, now is the morning. Because now is the morning, so if you ask “what time is it now“, the elder brother will answer “now is the morning“, the younger brother will answer “now is the afternoon“, combined with the problem stem information can be determined, the fat man is the elder brother, thin is the younger brother

context: The most densely populated cities, where the number of police officers is the largest as a percentage of the population, also have the lowest rates of “no-witness crimes.“ It appears that maintaining a high police presence will at least have the effect of effectively deterring such crimes.
question: Which of the following, if true, most effectively undermines the inference above?
A: The attitude of the police and the frequency of patrols vary greatly from city to city.
B: High population density itself makes it less likely that there will be no witnesses at the crime scene.
C: Many nonviolent crimes in large cities are drug-related
D: D Most criminals in densely populated cities are not caught by the police
explanation: From two phenomena: (1) In densely populated cities, the police account for the largest proportion; ② In densely populated cities, the crime rate of 'crime without witnesses' is also the lowest “, and the conclusion is summed up: a high proportion of police (cause) → reduces the crime rate of' crime without witnesses'

context: The realization of great dreams is never carried out smoothly in the calm and smooth, it is bound to be in the face of challenges and risks to forge ahead. Only when we meet a series of complex contradictions and problems calmly can we deeply realize that the problems after development are not less than when we do not develop, and if we meet a series of complex contradictions and problems calmly, then we can realize the great dream.
question: If the above statement is true, which of the following must be true
A: If we can deeply realize that there will be no fewer problems after development than there were before development, we will be able to forge ahead in coping with challenges and defusing risks.
B: If you realize your big dreams, you will be able to deal with a series of complex conflicts and problems calmly.
C: If I did not deal with a series of complex contradictions and problems calmly, I would struggle to cope with challenges and defuse risks.
D: Great dreams cannot be realized without a deep understanding that there will be no fewer problems after development than when development had not.
explanation: ① To realize the great dream (P1) → To forge ahead with difficulty in coping with challenges and resolving risks (Q1). ② A deep understanding that there will be no fewer problems after development than when there was no development (P2) → A calm response to a series of complex contradictions and problems (Q2). ③ Calmly coping with a series of complex contradictions and problems (P3) → realizing great dreams (Q3). Combining conditions ①②③ we can see that there will be no less problems after a deep understanding of the development (P2) → calmly deal with a series of complex contradictions and problems (Q2/P3) → realize a great dream (Q3/P1) → forge ahead in dealing with challenges and resolving risks (Q1). A: Option =P2 →Q1, and the question stem reasoning is consistent, must be true. B: Choice =Q3→P3, which is inconsistent with the reasoning of the problem stem and cannot be judged to be true or false. C: Choice =-P3→Q1, which is inconsistent with the reasoning, cannot be judged to be true or false. D: Choice =→P2→-Q3, it is not consistent with the reasoning, it is not true or false

context: A special guest house reported the theft of 2 million yuan in cash. After careful investigation, the security personnel came to the conclusion that the front desk manager, Mr. Sun, was responsible for the theft. The director said, “It is most unlikely.“ The security guard said, “When all other possibilities have been eliminated, the remaining possibilities, however unlikely they may seem, must be the truth.“
question: Which of the following, if true, most strongly undermines the security officer's account?
A: In fact, it is impossible for security personnel to know their manager better than the director.
B: The punishment of illegal acts cannot be based on logical reasoning but only on evidence.
C: Security personnel cannot exhaust all possibilities.
D: The husband of the receptionist surnamed Wang in the guest house has a criminal record
explanation: Security guard: When all other possibilities have been eliminated, the remaining possibilities must be the truth. Logically, if it is true that “all other possibilities“ can be “ruled out“, then “the remaining possibilities must be the truth“. C, however, states that it is impossible to “exclude all other possibilities“ and that the premises cannot be fulfilled, thus weakening the security argument. (D) Appeal to character. A good man may make mistakes. A former offender may not offend again. (D) The rest are irrelevant

context: A university needs to find employment for its graduates of 6 majors including mathematics, physics, chemistry, management, secretary and law. Now Fengyun and Jardine Hongyu come to the university for recruitment. It is known that each company can only recruit some graduates of the above 2-3 majors, and the following conditions should be met: (1) Companies that recruit chemistry majors also recruit mathematics majors. (2) Fengyun, a company recruited by Jardine Matheson, is also hiring. (3) There was only one position for secretary, and the company did not have a position for physics. (4) If Jardine Matheson is looking for a management major, it is looking for a secretarial major. (5) If Hongwoo is not looking for a secretarial major, then Jardine is looking for a secretarial major.
question: If only one company is looking for a physics major, which of the following can be obtained
A: Fengyun Company wants physics.
B: Fengyun Company wants to hire chemistry.
C: Jardine Matheson wants physics.
D: Jardine Matheson Recruitment Management.
explanation: The explanation“ can be converted into (1) chemistry → mathematics; (2) Jardine → clouds; (3) There is only one company recruiting secretary major, and the company does not recruit physics major; (4) Jardine Matheson Management → Jardine Matheson Secretary; (5) Hongyu Secretary → Jardine Secretary. It can be seen from (2) that if Jardine Jardine recruits physics, Fengyun will recruit physics, which is inconsistent with the fact that only one company recruits physics, so Jardine Jardine does not recruit physics. From (3) it can be seen that only one company is looking for secretaries, and from (2) it can be seen that Fengyun is also looking for the major that Jardine Jardine is looking for, so Jardine Jardine is not looking for secretaries. From (5), we can get: Jardine's Secretary → Hong Yu's Secretary. Also, according to (3), Hong Yu did not recruit physics, so the recruitment of physics must be Fengyun

context: In a study published in the Journal Pediatrics, leading researchers at a university School of medicine found that children who watched more than two hours of television a day before age 5 more than doubled their risk of behavioral problems as adults after following 2,702 families. question: Which of the following is true and best explains the above phenomenon
A: TV programs can make children curious and easily lead to violent tendencies in children.
B: There are many things in TV programs that tend to keep children in a state of stress and fear for a long time.
C: Watching too much TV will affect children's ability to interact with others, and over time, children will lack experience in dealing with others.
D: Watching TV for a long time every day is likely to cause fatigue in children's nervous system and affect their physical and mental health development
explanation: explanation: If children watch more than two hours of TV a day before the age of five, their risk of developing behavioral problems will more than double when they grow up

context: ergocline is a fungus that can thrive on the surface layer of grain seeds, especially in rye. Ergocline contains a toxic chemical that can harm humans. Rye was introduced to Europe in the Middle Ages. Rye was the main food source for poor farmers of that time, as it yielded better harvests in poor, wet lands where wheat did not grow.
question: Which of the following claims does the above information best support
A: ergosine was never found in Europe before the Middle Ages.
B: Before the Middle Ages the poor and wet lands of Europe were largely uncultivated
C: In medieval Europe, rich farmers were more aware than poor farmers of the toxic properties of ergostine
D: D: In medieval Europe, rich farmers were less vulnerable than poor farmers to the poisons contained in ergocline
explanation: explanation: (1) In medieval Europe, rye was the main source of food for poor farmers, not rich ones; (2) At that time, the toxic substance ergostine was often found in rye. It is clear from this that rich farmers were less vulnerable to ergot than poor farmers at that time.

context: The country's artificial food coloring, is made of aniline dye separated from coal tar as raw material, so it is also called coal tar pigment or aniline pigment, such as synthetic amaranth red, carmine red and lemon yellow. Occasionally eat food adding a certain amount of artificial food coloring, will not cause poisoning, diarrhea and other conditions. Therefore, people can safely and regularly consume foods with a small amount of artificial food coloring.
question: Which of the following, if true, most weakens the argument above?
A: It is not healthy to consume foods with small amounts of food coloring added.
B: Regular consumption has different effects on the human body than occasional consumption.
C: aniline dyes contain substances harmful to human health.
D: There have been no reported cases of poisoning from food coloring since synthetic coloring was introduced in 1981.
explanation: Since occasional consumption will not cause health problems, we conclude that regular consumption can be assured.

context: The law of the United States states that both a driver and a passenger must wear a seat belt when sitting in a moving car. Some people disagree with this. Their argument is that everyone has the right to take whatever risks he wants, as long as the risks do not bring harm to others. “So whether or not you wear a seat belt in a car is a private matter, just as it is a private matter whether someone is willing to take a risk to play the stock market or someone is willing to take a risk to go rock climbing.
question: Which of the following, if true, best challenges the objection above?
A: All airlines require every passenger to wear a seat belt during takeoff and landing, although indeed for the protection of each passenger and not to prevent injury to others.
B: Injuries and deaths caused by not wearing seat belts are one of the reasons that car insurance benefits are going up year after year
C: After the introduction of mandatory seatbelt laws, the death rate from automobile accidents in the United States decreased significantly
D: Risks such as investing in stocks or rock climbing are valuable risks, the risk of not wearing a seat belt is unnecessa
explanation: Everyone has the right to take the risks they wish, as long as the risks do not cause damage to others, and this explanation is used to object to the law requiring drivers to wear seat belts.

context: It is wrong to accuse a jealous man of being immoral. A person should only pay more for what he can control, and an emotion like jealousy is often beyond his control.
question: Suppose which of the following makes the above conclusion logically follow from the premises?
A: If a person is morally reprehensible for something, that person must be responsible for it.
B: Jealousy is only a psychological emotion which does not necessarily lead a person to commit an immoral act.
C: The object of jealousy is not necessarily morally superior; the emotion of jealousy can be justified in some circumstances.
D: No one else should be responsible for the emotions that arise out of one's control.
explanation: Premise: jealousy + uncontrollable + not responsible. Conclusion: Jealousy → cannot be blamed for immorality. At this point, it is observed that the repeated concept “jealousy“ in the premise and conclusion is aligned to the left, so it can be directly supplemented with “up → down“, that is, “no responsibility → no blame for immorality“, and the inverse equivalent can be obtained with “blame for immorality → responsibility“

context: The most currently accepted theory of elementary particles is the“ standard theory “. D: A scientist has proposed a new theory that upends our understanding of elementary particles
explanation: The first step: Find the arguments and arguments. The argument here is that elementary particles in the universe are nearly found, and even if they were, they could be explained by standard theory. The argument is that “Every discovered elementary particle can be explained according to the standard theory.“ “Elementary particles such as protons, neutrons, and electrons have been discovered one after another.“ Step 2: Determine the weakening mode. There is a causal link between an argument and an argument, so weaken the argument. Step 3: Judge the effects of each option. A, B, A new theory has been proposed. B, A new theory has been proposed. D, A, B, D. C) The newly discovered particle is not consistent with the prediction made by the standard theory. That is to say, the newly discovered particle cannot be explained by the standard theory. C) The newly discovered particle can not be explained by the standard theory

context: In response to whether Iraq actually possessed weapons of mass destruction or merely sold and tried to acquire them, US President George W. Bush said:“ What difference does it make? If he got those weapons. He will become more dangerous. He is a threat that America should deal with after September 11. “Over a period of 12 years. The world has been saying he's dangerous. Until now we have dealt with that danger. That is to say, Bush said. “Whether Saddam Hussein actually had weapons of mass destruction made no difference to whether he planned to have them.
question: Which of the following differs from Bush's logic of speaking?
A: If Bush thought about taking a bribe, then Bush actually took a bribe.
B: Bin Laden wanted to be good. That means Bin Laden is good.
C: The United States thinks that September 11 did not happen.“ 9-11 “really didn't happen.
D: If the Iraq war had not been waged, more than 1,000 American servicemen and women would not have died in Iraq.
explanation: Similarity and comparison questions of reasoning methods. Bush's logic is that the planned possession of weapons of mass destruction equals the actual possession of weapons of mass destruction, that is, the subjective imagination equals the objective existence. A, B, and C all commit the same logical error. Only D.

context: Alcohol itself has no apparent carcinogenic ability, but many epidemiological studies have found that alcohol consumption is positively associated with the risk of developing many cancers -- that is, an increased incidence of many cancers among people who drink alcohol.
question: Which of the following, if true, best supports the above finding?
A: Acetaldehyde, a metabolite of alcohol in the body, can adhere stably to DNA molecules and cause cancer or mutation
B: Sweet and strong alcohol is widely consumed in Eastern Europe, a region with a high incidence of esophageal cancer
C: Tobacco contains a variety of carcinogenic components whose metabolites in the human body are similar to those of alcohol
D: D) Scientists estimate that 80 percent of digestive tract cancers could be avoided if Americans gave up smoking and alcoh
explanation: Step 1: Find the explanation. Explanation: Alcohol consumption is positively associated with the risk of many types of cancer, regardless of the evidence. Step 2: Analyze the options. A. Alcohol is not carcinogenic, but the risk of cancer is higher in people who drink alcohol. A. Alcohol is not carcinogenic, but the risk of cancer is higher in people who drink alcohol. B) Using Eastern European people and sweet spirits, the argument is strengthened by example, but not by explanation. A) Alcohol and the human body are general, B) people from Eastern Europe and sweet spirits are individual cases. B) The principle of overall reinforcement is greater than that of partial reinforcement. C) Tobacco can cause cancer, and its metabolites are similar to those of alcohol, so it is reinforced by analogy. However, analogy is only A possibility strengthening. In order to prove that metabolites of alcohol can cause cancer, or to further analyze whether the carcinogenic mechanism of alcohol and tobacco is the same, in fact, explanations like A are still needed. Therefore, it is not as clear as item A, excluded; D) If you quit smoking and alcohol, you can avoid cancer of the digestive tract. It is not clear whether tobacco or alcohol is carcinogenic, or whether the two together can cause cancer

context: In 2000, 40% of the total value of the Fund of funds of Hongfa Investment Funds was spent on bond purchases. D) Bonds and stocks are not the same thing

context: The middle school has found that some students are using poker in their spare time to play games with a gambling nature, so they are not allowed to bring cards into school. A: Coins are not as convenient as playing cards. B: “Hard to find out“ does not mean “impossible to find out“. C: Gambling is bad for us, but it is not directly related to the argument. D: “Some“ students play cards without gambling. It is not certain that “all“ students do not gamble with cards

context: Zhao Qing must be an exceptional coach. It's only been one year since she transferred to our university to coach the women's volleyball team. The team's performance has improved by leaps and bounds.
question: Which of the following, if true, is most likely to weaken the argument above?

B: After being transferred to the university as the coach of the women's volleyball team, Zhao Qing made an order from the school leaders that she must win the championship of the National College Students League, but only got a bronze medal.

explanation: We have the following two relations: (1) The achievement is related to Zhao Qing; (2) Zhao is an outstanding coach whose achievements can prove him; For ① weakened: the results have nothing to do with Zhao Qing, such as D. context: There is now a view that with the popularity of credit cards and the development of mobile payments in recent years, coins will inevitably quickly fade out of circulation.
question: The following, if true, most strongly refutes this vi
A: The coins of each country are miniature reliefs carved with characteristic symbols of the local history, culture and customs, which are themselves of high collection value
B: The same fate was predicted for coins when the savings card began to take off, but the coins did not disappear from circulation at al
C: The coin itself has a low face value, but it is this“ worthless “characteristic that makes it play an important circulation role in retail and other aspect
D: At present, some of the vending machines and other devices that play an important role in our lives still support coin payment only, and these devices will not be replaced in the next few years
explanation: Step one: Identify the arguments and arguments. Argument: With the popularity of credit cards and the development of mobile payments in recent years, it is inevitable that coins will quickly fade out of circulation. Argument: None. Step 2: Analyze the options one by one. A: The coin will quickly fade out of circulation. The coin is valuable for collection. The coin is not an option. B) Coins will quickly fade out of circulation when credit cards and mobile payments become popular. Coins will not fade out of circulation when bank savings cards are popular. C) The argument is that coins will fade out of circulation market quickly. The argument is that coins have the characteristics of “worthless“ and play an important role in circulation in retail, but whether they can be replaced and whether they will eventually fade out of circulation market is not clear. It is an unclear option that cannot be weakened or excluded. D) The coin will quickly fade out of circulation, the important equipment in life still support coins only, and these equipment will not be replaced in recent years, so the coin cannot be quickly replaced, weaken the argument, retain; B is the weakest by analogy, D is the strongest. D is the strongest. D is the strongest

context: Popularity and reputation reflect the extent to which the public recognizes and praises an organization, both of which are the goals emphasized and pursued by public relations. Public relations planners need to make it clear that only by increasing awareness can they continue to improve the reputation of their organization. (2) Visibility can produce positive effect only on the basis of reputation, that is, positive effect of visibility → based on metyr. ③ Reputation should be based on visibility as a condition, in order to fully display its social value, namely: reputation fully display social value - - to visibility as a condition.

context: The water tardigrade is a small aquatic animal, also known as a tardigrade. The water tardigrade is the most resilient creature known on Earth, able to survive in extremely stressful environments without protection. The tardigrade's strange abilities have led researchers to investigate its genome. Now, the first genome sequencing of a tardigrade shows that a large number of genes were acquired from other species during their evolution through horizontal gene transfer (the transfer of DNA between the genomes of different species)
question: If the following are true, the above view is most strongly challenged:
A: Genetic testing has found that tardigrades contain a gene whose protein is resistant to DNA damage in cultured human cells
B: Tardigrades can survive for a long time in the vacuum of space and can be successfully revived after more than 30 years of freezing
C: Water tardigrades inherit all their genes from their ancestors, and no genetic material has been found to come from plants or microorganisms
D: There is a very strange“ mixing and matching “of the genetic material in the water tardigrades, which allows the water tardigrades to grow and develop in more complex ways
explanation: Step one: Identify the arguments and arguments. Argument: During tardigrade evolution, a large number of genes were acquired from other species through horizontal gene transfer (the transfer of DNA between the genomes of different species). Argument: None. Step 2: Analyze the options one by one. A. The water tardigrades have acquired A large number of genes from other species. The water tardigrades have a gene whose protein is resistant to DNA damage in human cultured cells. B) The argument is that tardigrades have acquired a large number of genes from other species. The argument is that tardigrades can survive in extreme environments such as the vacuum of space and freezing. C. The water tardigrades inherited all their genes from their ancestors. No genetic material in the water tardigrades was found to come from plants or microorganisms, indicating that the water tardigrades did not acquire a large number of genes from other species. D) There is “mixing“ in the genetic material of the water tardigrades, “mixing“ suggests that the water tardigrades may have acquired a large number of genes from other species, which supports the argument

context: Lao Chang likes winter rain; Dongyu likes everyone who likes Lao Lu.
question: If the above judgment is true, which of the following may be true?

context: “Previous studies have suggested that volcanic eruptions release heat and trigger global warming. But recent research has found that, far from triggering a rise in global temperatures, volcanic eruptions can blunt the effects of global warming.
question: Which of the following is true and best supports the conclusion above?
A: Research shows that during volcanic eruptions, underground magma erupts from the surface and comes into contact with the air to produce oxidation reactions, causing local temperatures to rise.
B: Volcanic eruptions suppress bacteria that decompose organic matter containing methane, an inflammable gas that produces heat.
C: Research shows that as the world gradually warms, volcanic eruptions become less frequent.
D: Research has found that sulfur dioxide, a volcanic substance, can form“ water particles “with atmospheric substances and reflect sunlight, reducing heat radiation to the ground and delaying global warming.
explanation: The explanation“ is that the eruption will not cause global temperatures to rise, and that it will weaken global warming. E explains how volcanic eruptions may delay global warming

context: Two-thirds of jurors agree that the witness gave false evidence about the time, place, or motive of the defendant's crime.
question: Which of the following can be concluded from the above statement?
A: Two thirds of the jurors agreed that the witness had given false evidence about the time of the crime.
B: Two thirds of the jurors agreed that the witness gave false evidence about the place where the defendant committed the crime.
C: On at least one of the three questions - when, where, or what motivated the defendant to commit the crime - two-thirds of the jurors agreed that the witness had perjured himself on that question.
D: None of the above can be inferred from the conclusion of the question stem.
explanation: Options A and B are the same structure and are not considered. Option C is intrusive, but note that two-thirds of the jurors believe that “perjury was given.“ As to where they believe perjury was given, time, place, and motive are all possible

context: Having experienced the shock of the worldwide stock market slump, the government of Country T claims that the shock of the stock market slump it has experienced is due to the recent rapid denationalization of some domestic enterprises.
question: Which of the following, if in fact actionable, is most conducive to the evaluation of the above appropriate claims of the Government of State T?
A: Compare the positive and negative effects of the recent process of denationalization of some enterprises in Country T at both macro and micro levels.
B: Compare the extent to which country T has been hit by this stock market crash with the extent to which countries with similar economic conditions have not recently denationalized their enterprises.
C: Calculate the average loss value of individual enterprises in Country T during the stock market turmoil.
D: Using econometric methods to predict the time of the next stock market turbulence in country T.
explanation: T country's government's claim that the shock it is experiencing from the stock market plunge is caused by the recent rapid denationalization of some domestic enterprises. The government of the People's Republic of China. The government of Country T's claim can be obtained by comparing Country T's “extent to which it has been hit by the stock market crash“ with “the extent to which countries with similar economic situations have not recently denationalized their enterprises“. If countries with similar economic conditions that have not recently denationalized their enterprises are not hit by the stock market crash or are hit to a lesser extent, then the government of Country T's claim is valid.

context: As an environmental protection enthusiast, Dr. Zhao advocates low-carbon life and actively promotes energy conservation and emission reduction. But I don't agree with him, because as a university teacher, he has taken up a lot of time for scientific research. So far, he hasn't even been appraised by an associate professor. How can his views be convincing?
question: Which of the following argument's errors is most similar to the above?
A: “Mr. Zhang wants equal pay for equal work and advocates equal pay per piece regardless of age or rank, provided the quality is the same. Isn't she just saying this because she is young and of low rank? She's really looking out for her own interests.
B: I heard recently that you have made so many comments about the management system of our company. It's unbelievable! Is your supervisor treating you poorly? You do so, it is clear that and unit leaders can not get by.
C: We have heard that you have some objection to the appointment of Mr. Li as the head of the Information Section. No one else has raised an opinion but you. It seems that your opinion is wrong.
D: There is a view that only what is seen directly can be assured of its existence. But no one can see protons, electrons, which are scientifically proven to exist objectively. So, that's wrong.
explanation: Dr. Zhao's explanation is that his views on energy conservation and emission reduction are not convincing. The explanation lies in his personal circumstances.“ The problem with this argument is that the arguments used to refute a point are based on the personal circumstances of the person making the point, and these personal circumstances have nothing to do with whether the point is true or not. This non-formal fallacy is called “ appeal to the individual “ and belongs to the “ appeal to irrelevancy of the non-formal fallacies. “resorting to irrelevant“ include “resorting to personal“ “appeal to the people“ “appeal to emotion“ “appeal to authority“ “strong appeal to “ etc.

context: East Asians appear to be more modest, but psychological studies have shown that they are just as proud and confident as people who have been raised in other cultures. A team of researchers recruited 40 volunteers, half of them from East Asian countries and the rest from Western countries. They showed the volunteers a number of positive and negative words and asked them which adjectives suited them. As a result, the volunteers, regardless of their cultural background, tended to describe themselves with more positive adjectives and rated some of the more negative traits as inappropriate. The researchers believe this indicates that participants were equally motivated to make themselves look good, regardless of their cultural background
question: Which of the following, if true, most weakens the argument above:
A: East Asians tend to think negatively about themselves, while Westerners tend to overestimate their own abilities
B: When volunteers were asked to describe themselves in positive terms, they all responded in the same way
C: modesty among East Asians is just a cultural convention and they have the same self-esteem as Westerners
D: Brain waves of volunteers were found to be similar regardless of their cultural background
explanation: Step 1: Identify the arguments and arguments. Argument: The people taking the test are equally motivated to beautify themselves, regardless of their cultural background. The argument: The volunteers were shown both positive and negative words and asked which adjectives suited them. As a result, the volunteers, regardless of their cultural background, tended to describe themselves with more positive adjectives and rated some of the more negative traits as inappropriate. Step 2: Analyze the options. A. East Asians have no motive to beautify themselves, no matter what their cultural background, they have the same motive to beautify themselves. B) only when the volunteers were asked to describe themselves in positive terms, but the question did not have this restriction, the topic is inconsistent, has no choice, cannot be weakened, excluded; C) There is no correlation between having self-esteem and having an incentive to beautify oneself. D: There is no correlation between identical brain waves and the motivation to beautify oneself.
